solution.text:
Given expression is :
(_{i}_(cosec(A)-sin(A)))\(\times \)(_{j}_sec(A)-_{j}_cos(A))
change all the trigonometric ratios in cosine and sine
which gives
{_{i}_(\(1\over sin(A)\) - sin(A))}{\(_{j}_\over cos(A)\)-_{j}_cos(A)}
_{i}_\((1-sin^2(A))\over sin(A)\)\((_{j}_-_{j}_cos^2(A))\over cos(A)\)
now take _{j}_ common
_{i}_\((1-sin^2(A))\over sin(A)\)_{j}_\(1-cos^2(A))\over cos(A)\)
_{{i*j}}_\(cos^2(A)\over sin(A)\)\(sin^2(A)\over cos(A)\)
which finally gives
_{{i*j}}_sin(A)\(\times\)cos(A)

content.text:
simplify the given expression
_{i}_[cosec(A)-sin(A)]\(\times \)(_{j}_sec(A)-_{j}_cos(A)), and choose the correct option.
